title: SpaceX valuation set to reach $127 billion after new $1.7 billion funding round
summary: CNBC reports that SpaceX is seeking to raise at least $1.725 billion in its first funding round of 2022, potentially boosting the...

title: Biden vows to expand space cooperation with South Korea, Japan
summary: U.S. President Joe Biden promised to expand space cooperation with Japan and South Korea during back-to-back summits with the leaders of two East Asian allies.

title: Coverage Set for NASA’s Boeing Orbital Flight Test-2 Return to Earth
summary: NASA will provide live coverage of the upcoming return activities for the agency’s Boeing Orbital Flight Test-2 (OFT-2). As part of the uncrewed flight test, Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner spacecraft will depart from the International Space Station for a landing in the western United States.

title: NASA Announces Armstrong Flight Research Center Director to Retire
summary: David McBride, director of NASA’s Armstrong Flight Research Center in California, announced plans to retire on June 30 after 35 years of service to the agency. He began his career at NASA as an intern.

title: How NASA finally melted its giant “self-licking ice cream cone”
summary: "Government should be about getting the taxpayer the best value."

title: Industry pushes for NASA reauthorization
summary: As House and Senate conferees begin work to reconcile competitiveness bills, industry groups are pushing Congress to either include a NASA authorization bill in that legislation or pass a standalone bill.

title: Boeing Starliner joins SpaceX’s Crew Dragon at the International Space Station
summary: Boeing’s Starliner crew capsule has successfully rendezvoused, approached, and docked with the International Space Station for the first time, marking major several...

title: Military looking for new ways to acquire and use commercial satellite data
summary: Space Systems Command is trying to figure out how to exploit traditional and new types of commercial space data

title: Starliner launches to remain on Atlas 5
NASA plans early June rollout of SLS for next countdown test
summary: NASA is gearing up to perform another practice countdown of the Space Launch System in mid-June as it completes repairs to the vehicle from previous tests.
